materials.title: 2023年6月大学英语四级听力真题第二套
materials.transcript: 本听力测试包含三个部分：A部分为新闻报道听力，B部分为对话听力，C部分为短文听力。各部分均有相应的题目和选项。

questions.question: What happened to the man mentioned in the news?
options: A) A man was bitten by a snake.
B) A man was taken to a hospital.
C) A man kept a 4-foot snake as a pet.
D) A man fell off his toilet seat.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到一名男子在抬起马桶盖时被一条4英尺长的蛇咬了(a man being bitten by a 4-foot snake when he lifted his toilet seat)。

questions.question: What was unclear according to the police officer?
options: A) Where the snake had been taken.
B) Whether the snake was infected.
C) How the snake was captured.
D) Who owned the snake.
questions.explanation: 警官表示不清楚蛇的主人是谁(It was unclear who the owner was)。

questions.question: What has Andrea Belcher been doing since last April?
options: A) Taking her trash out in fancy dresses.
B) Amusing herself by going to ball parties.
C) Sharing her photos with famous movie stars.
D) Posting her daughter's photos on social media.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到Andrea Belcher自去年4月以来一直在做一件不寻常且有趣的事情，就是穿着晚礼服拿出垃圾(get dressed up to take out the trash)。

questions.question: Why has Andrea kept up the videos?
options: A) To make herself popular.
B) To amuse people.
C) To please her daughter.
D) To record her achievements.
questions.explanation: Andrea解释说她这样做是为了给人们带来一点乐趣，让人们微笑(how nice it was to have a little bit of fun and craziness that made people smile)。

questions.question: What can customers do at Frank's restaurant?
options: A) Eat as much as they want for $10.
B) Have a chance of winning a $100 prize.
C) Have a meal even if they have no money.
D) Get a free meal after answering some questions.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到在Frank's餐厅，即使没有钱但仍然饥饿的顾客可以从板子上取一张收据，不问任何问题就能获得食物(No money, but still hungry? No problem...Anyone who is hungry and wants something to eat can take one, no questions asked)。

questions.question: How did the idea for the board of free meals start?
options: A) It was brought up by two staffers.
B) It helped to popularize her restaurant.
C) It originated from a donation to her staff.
D) It was suggested by some of her customers.
questions.explanation: 免费餐食板的想法源于一位捐赠者给餐厅每位员工100美元的捐款(The idea for the board of free meals started after a donor came in with $100 for each member of its staff)。

questions.question: What has happened since the drive started two weeks ago?
options: A) Fifty customers have offered donations.
B) More people have been giving than taking.
C) Many people have come to eat at the restaurant.
D) Most staffers have received messages of kindness.
questions.explanation: 活动开展两周以来，提供餐票的人比领取的人多得多(there are a lot more people giving tickets than receiving)。

questions.question: What is Steve Pinker's occupation?
options: A) He is a psychologist.
B) He is a famous writer.
C) He is a host for a TV program.
D) He is a primary school teacher.
questions.explanation: 对话开头介绍Steve Pinker是McGill大学的心理学家(psychologist Steve Pinker from McGill University)。

questions.question: What is the topic of today's program?
options: A) Why social media accounts vanish without a trace.
B) Why parents raise their children in different ways.
C) Why people fail to respond to emails promptly.
D) Why friends break off contact all of a sudden.
questions.explanation: 今天节目的话题是为什么朋友突然消失(why friends suddenly disappear)。

questions.question: How do children with an anxious attachment style react to a relationship breakdown with their parents?
options: A) They simply shut themselves down.
B) They avoid showing their emotions.
C) They scream to get their parents back.
D) They attempt to ignore the whole situation.
questions.explanation: 具有焦虑型依恋风格的孩子在与父母关系破裂时会尖叫和哭泣，试图让父母回来(children with an anxious attachment style scream and cry to get their parents to come back)。

questions.question: What does the man say about insecurely attached persons?
options: A) They may regard any difference as the end of a relationship.
B) They are on better terms with friends and romantic partners.
C) They try to express their feelings and thoughts effectively.
D) They attach more value to their relationships with others.
questions.explanation: 不安全依恋的人可能会将任何分歧，无论在你看来多么微小，都视为关系的终结(To them, a difference, no matter how small in your eyes, signals the end of the relationship)。

questions.question: What does the man say is special about Japanese jeans?
options: A) Their price.
B) Their color.
C) Their quality.
D) Their design.
questions.explanation: 男士表示日本牛仔裤的特别之处在于其质量，他提到日本牛仔裤使用更高质量的面料，有更密的编织，比世界上任何其他牛仔裤都更耐用(the fabric they use is of a higher quality...They have a denser weave and a more durable than any other genes in the world)。

questions.question: What does the woman think about jeans?
options: A) Jeans are a typical American garment.
B) America makes the best-known brands of jeans.
C) America has the best weaving tools in the world.
D) Jeans are available in a greater variety in America.
questions.explanation: 女士认为牛仔裤是典型的美国服装(I would have thought America made the best jeans because it's a typical American garment)。

questions.question: What does the man say about the dyes used for Japanese jeans?
options: A) They are artificial.
B) They are natural.
C) They are unique.
D) They are special.
questions.explanation: 男士提到日本牛仔裤使用的染料是天然的(the dyes are natural)。

questions.question: What does the man say about Japanese jeans at the end of the conversation?
options: A) They are for casual wearing.
B) They are popular with boys.
C) They are much too pricey.
D) They are worth the price.
questions.explanation: 对话结束时，男士表示日本牛仔裤虽然价格昂贵，但完全值得(They are a little pricey, yes. But...I think they're totally worth it)。

questions.question: How does the speaker feel after watching a superhero movie?
options: A) He desires more in life.
B) He wants to see it again.
C) He feels as inspired as other audience members.
D) He longs to become a superstar himself.
questions.explanation: 演讲者表示每次看完超级英雄电影后，他都会感到一种渴望，意识到生活中应该有更多东西(I experience a sense of longing, realizing that there should be more in life)。

questions.question: What does the speaker say about the plot of superhero films?
options: A) It is rather unrealistic.
B) It is extremely artistic.
C) It is somewhat complicated.
D) It is relatively predictable.
questions.explanation: 演讲者表示每部超级英雄电影的情节都变得相对可预测(The plot of each superhero film has become relatively predictable)。

questions.question: How do the elites criticize superhero films?
options: A) They are biased against women.
B) They are basically misleading.
C) They are full of shootings.
D) They are too simple.
questions.explanation: 精英们批评超级英雄电影太简单(These movies are criticized as being too simple)。

questions.question: What does the speaker say about storytelling?
options: A) It can highlight leadership.
B) It can help connect people.
C) It is a means to inspire creative thinking.
D) It is an intuitive way to solidify friendship.
questions.explanation: 演讲者表示讲故事能在人与人之间建立联系(Storytelling forges connections among people)。

questions.question: What do good stories do to listeners?
options: A) Allow them to recite data points.
B) Make them more open to learning.
C) Enable them to remember the main idea.
D) Stimulate them to engage in discussions.
questions.explanation: 好的故事让听众更愿意学习(They allow the listener to enter the story, making them more open to learning)。

questions.question: What can leaders do with a simple personal story?
options: A) Inspire listeners' imagination.
B) Enrich their own experience.
C) Convey fundamental values.
D) Explain insightful ideas.
questions.explanation: 领导者可以通过简单的个人故事传达基本价值观(With a simple personal story, they can convey fundamental values)。

questions.question: What is the passage mainly about?
options: A) Immigrants outnumber U.S.-born Americans.
B) Immigrants have been contributing to the U.S.
C) Another wave of immigrants is hitting the U.S.
D) The number of immigrants to the U.S. is declining.
questions.explanation: 这篇短文主要讲述移民对美国的贡献(immigrants are still contributing to America today)。

questions.question: What does the passage say about immigrants to the U.S.?
options: A) More of them expect their children to succeed in business.
B) They have fewer chances to be hired by U.S. companies.
C) They have founded most Fortune 500 companies.
D) More of them are successful business people.
questions.explanation: 短文提到移民不仅更频繁地创业，而且往往取得成功，超过40%的财富500强公司的创始人是移民或移民的子女(They are often succeeding. Over 40% of Fortune 500 companies had a founder who was either an immigrant or the child of one)。

questions.question: What does the passage say about immigrants' debt level?
options: A) They have higher installment loan debt than native-born Americans.
B) Nineteen percent of them borrow money from friends and family.
C) Their level of debt is lower than that of native-born Americans.
D) Thirty-four percent of them use credit for their daily purchases.
questions.explanation: 短文提到移民的债务水平明显低于美国本土出生的人(This results in significantly lower levels of debt than native-born Americans)。

questions.question: What do immigrants tend to do according to the passage?
options: A) Keep their traditional values and old habits.
B) Find employment in competitive businesses.
C) Borrow money from financial institutions.
D) Collaborate with native-born Americans.
questions.explanation: 短文提到移民之所以表现良好，是因为他们保持了来自祖国的价值观和习惯(The values and habits they bring from their own homelands help explain some of the success)。

vocabulary.example: Police have reported a man being bitten by a 4-foot snake when he lifted his toilet seat on Sunday morning.
She put on her black off-the-shoulder gown and put her trash bin out.
The idea for the board of free meals started after a donor came in with $100 for each member of its staff.
There are two different attachment styles: an anxious attachment style and an avoidant attachment style.
They have a denser weave and are more durable than any other jeans in the world.
The plot of each superhero film has become relatively predictable.
From 1996 to 2016, the pace at which immigrants started businesses was double that of U.S.-born individuals.
